object.course_desc: Introduction to the social, cultural, economic and political implications of the movement of people with a multidisciplinary and multiscale approach to topics such as migration and immigration, diaspora identities, global culture, and transnationalism.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): second-year standing.
Lecture and discussion three hours a week.

object.course_desc: Advanced topics in Migration and Diaspora Studies. Topics vary from term to term.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): Fourth-year standing or permission of the department.
Also offered at the graduate level, with different requirements, as MGDS5900, for which additional credit is precluded.
Seminar three hours a week
object.course_prerequisites: Fourth-year standing or permission of the department.
